body_content.explanation: to remove the moisture from something so it becomes completely dry; to lose all moisture and become completely dry:
examples: Intensive farming has desiccated the land.
Some plants wither quickly and lose their power of recovery if allowed to desiccate.

body_content.explanation: to become damaged or destroyed by losing an important quality; to damage or destroy something in this way:
examples: The global economy is desiccating by the day.
He was politically and emotionally desiccated by the scandal.
